Detailed Description

A 'job control file' (JCF) RCO.

The JCF RCO is used by default for controlling parallel job execution. It is called a JCF-RCO because execution is controlled by a file placed in the user code directory, which is created by the first parallel job and contains information such as the number of particles remaining to be simulated, number of jobs running, combined result of all parallel jobs, etc. This RCO objects requires that file locking works on the file system containing the EGS_HOME directory becuase the JCF is locked prior to being modified by one of the jobs to prevent multiply jobs modifying the file at the same time. For more details see PIRS-877.
